metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40083 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Knot Resolver before 5.3.2 is prone to an assertion failure, triggerable by a remote attacker in an edge case (NSEC3 with too many iterations used for a positive wildcard proof).

notes.Note: ccdm94> this issue seems to have been introduced by commit 7107faeb (5.3.1). Therefore, versions that do not include this commit will not be vulnerable.

criterions.comment: knot-resolver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
